TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . He is a lawyer practising in GPE and the owner of a parcel of land in the municipality of Königstetten , which is designated as “ forest ” land in the zoning plan . On parts of this parcel – QUANTITY – he runs an organic farm on a part - time basis , breeding sheep and goats . Besides that , he keeps bees and grows herbs .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant applied to the mayor of Königstetten for a building permit for a shed , to be used as a shelter for sheep and goats in DATE and beehives in DATE . It is also designed as a refuge for farm workers . He therefore submitted construction plans for the planned shed and a map of the land in question .

CARDINAL . NORP The mayor rejected the applicant 's request on DATE . Relying on a report by an agricultural expert at ORG , he stated that , in view of its shape , size and design , it would not qualify as a farm building and that even if it was an agricultural construction , it could not be erected on the land in question , as the latter had been designated as forest and grassland .
CARDINAL . The applicant lodged an appeal with the municipality of Königstetten on DATE . On DATE the municipality dismissed his appeal on the same grounds .

CARDINAL . Subsequently , on DATE , the applicant filed an objection ( PERSON ) with ORG and requested it to hear representatives of ORG ( ORG , PERSON ) and the NORP beekeeper association ( ORG , PERSON ) as experts who would prove that the building he intended to erect was necessary for the intended agricultural enterprise .
CARDINAL . ORG quashed the municipality 's decision on DATE and referred the case back to the municipal council . It stated that the municipality had failed to address all the points of appeal .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant lodged further grounds in support of his appeal on DATE , DATE and DATE . In addition to his comments on the decision of DATE , he filed requests for the taking of evidence . He also submitted a statement by ORG and a document he referred to as a business plan .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE requested the applicant to comment on an expert opinion it had obtained from ORG at ORG ( GPE - bauamt ) on DATE . It stated that by far the largest part of the land was covered by forest , which would impede serious agricultural activities . With reference to the earlier decisions , it repeated that , judging by its design and shape , the building at issue would be untypical of an agricultural shed and that the applicant could be assumed never to have intended to carry on agricultural activities , but rather to use it for different purposes .

CARDINAL . The applicant commented on the expert opinion on DATE . Claiming that the authorities had incorrectly established the relevant facts , he contended that the expert opinion was in breach of NORP law and ORG law . Besides that , the applicant repeated his request to obtain opinions from the ORG , the ORG and a certain organic farming association ( Biobauernverband ORG ) in order to prove the feasibility of the business plan and its compliance with the relevant legal criteria . He also filed an application for an on - site inspection of the land at issue .

CARDINAL . On DATE the municipal council also rejected the applicant 's appeal . It held that the planned construction would conflict with the zoning plan and that the building would not resemble a shed for agricultural use .

CARDINAL . The applicant filed an objection ( PERSON ) with ORG again on DATE , submitting that the municipality had relied solely on an incorrect expert opinion without carrying out investigations of its own . In addition , he claimed that the decision was in breach of ORG law .
CARDINAL . Subsequently , on DATE , the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG and requested an oral hearing .

CARDINAL . On DATE , without holding an oral hearing , ORG rejected the complaint as inadmissible for non - exhaustion of administrative remedies , as the applicant had failed to file an objection against the decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicant 's objection of CARDINAL DATE was dismissed by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicant lodged a further complaint with ORG on DATE and repeated his request for an oral hearing .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's complaint and rejected his request for an oral hearing . It found that , despite its request for a detailed business plan , the applicant had failed to provide CARDINAL . Accordingly , the alleged need for a shed for the so - called agricultural enterprise had not been made out .
